author: laudiacay
content: following up on this. if i were to want to write an EIP is there like a guide or something

author: laudiacay
content: or an implementation- which eth impl should i do this against? can i pick? can i do revm or hevm or another rust one?

author: laudiacay
content: would i need to do test vectors?

author: ralexstokes
content:
i'd just pick another EIP and use that as a template

if you want to implement in Geth or another execution client, that would help demonstrate the complexity of the EIP's change

test vectors aren't exactly required but the more you do the more convincing your argument for "why this change and why now" is

author: ralexstokes
content: this being said, are there concrete, compelling use cases for this particular hash fn as a precompile?

author: ralexstokes
content: this is just my one take but i'm not seeing enough so far to justify this addition

author: ralexstokes
content: (point being, i'd work on having wide buy-in on the motivation before even doing any of the engineering work)

author: laudiacay
content: Makes sense. Is this the right place to try and get that buy-in?

author: laudiacay
content: I put a defense of why I think this should be added on ethmagicians

author: laudiacay
content: but Iâ€™m not sure how to get people to engage hehe

author: sky.cactus
content: The hardest part of the Ethereum development process is getting people to engage.
